storyInfo: Siege's forces are inspired by the victory. They discover an identification code belonging to the Exemplars and decide to take up the name. A viscount finds Delphine and tries to persuade her to join the Duke of Caster, but Delphine refuses.

attributes.text: No one can be told what a battlefield is. You have to see it for yourself.

My friends and I spent a lot of time in Norport's video shop watching old movies, many of them war movies. There were story of heroes, but also stories of terror, depicted by directors with a sadistic streak.
I remembered that the four of us all had nightmares that night.
\nEven now, I seem to be drifting in a dream.

attributes.content: We took on a few soldiers who were still breathing when we passed through that valley. Oh, and the survivors have caught up to our column.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: They're all Infected. As they should be, after spending a night in a corpse-filled crater.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You did disinfect properly, didn't you? You could have gotten Active Originium dust on you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: Where are we, Hannah?
\nI'm a little...

attributes.content: Don't worry, I have experience with large-scale Active Originium zones from my time in County Hillock.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We undertook the cleanup according to SOP.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The soldiers were conscripts under the Duke of Ashworth. They said that their company simply pulled out after the battle, without rescuing the wounded or cleaning up the battlefield.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.text: Horn? Is Hannah angry at me because I acted on my own?
\nWhy is she ignoring me?

attributes.content: He said he had a friend who had been crying for help by a shallow puddle all night. Couldn't turn himself over because his legs were injured.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: He had drowned by the time we found him.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The puddle was ankle-deep. He would have survived if someone had just flipped him over.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I examined the area. Looks like they marched into a Royal Court trap. Some Sarkaz mercenaries must have sacrificed themselves by acting as bait.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.text: There's something on my chest?
\nI can't breathe... Morgan... Morgan?
\nI feel something hot roiling in my chest.

attributes.content: But... how could they have gone down without a fight?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That's not surprising. Other than the strongest dukes, professional soldiers make up only a quarter of the armies of the other ducal armies, at best.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Most Victorian soldiers are conscripted, sent into battle after only a few months of basic training on how to use a crossbow or Arts Unit.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Frankly, if not for this war, the officers and soldiers may never have spoken to each other their entire lives.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina wouldn't like to hear it.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I hate this. How could you trust your back to someone whom you don't trust?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: Why does nobody hear me?
\nI feel the taste of iron in my mouth, something boiling, rushing up my throat.

attributes.content: Mother never answered my questions. She said I would find the answer, someday—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: *Cough*... argh!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Take it easy, Morgan... my neck... I can't breathe...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Sorry, got excited. You had been unconscious for two days.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You were running a fever. At least the wound on your chest was healing well, otherwise we would have been even more worried.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Where are we...? We aren't in Chetleigh anymore, are we?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: They are silent. What happened?

attributes.content: Ahem... Maybe I should explain.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We pulled out two days ago. We're back to our original encampment.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: At Horn's advice, we pulled out as quickly as possible before the Duke of Gododdin's fleet entered Chetleigh, avoiding direct contact with the reinforcements.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: ...Horn?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We have a lot of... complicated circumstances. It's going to cause a lot of complications if we establish official communications with the dukes' troops.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I've talked about this with Misery, and the others support what we're doing.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: While we still have troops formerly under the command of Duke Windermere, their military ID has expired, and there's a high risk of 'friendly fire'.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Well, not so much expired as no longer recognized...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No need to mince words about the nobles' dirty deeds.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: It's the same deal as gangs fighting for territory.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.text: Indra's right.
\nSince when did the war become like this?
\nWe could give help to where we can see, but what about the places beyond?

attributes.content: ...What's the situation?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Some have chosen to join Duke Gododdin's forces and continue the fight. Gododdin's officers didn't even say anything about the Infected. The majority have chosen to stay with us, however.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They trust us. Or should I say, they trust you. We won! Morale is really high right now.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They're even joking about the old conflicts now.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We did it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Your plan worked. We made it. It's very possible that no one will ever know the sacrifices we made...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's just one small victory in a greater war.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: I look at Delphine's tired face. A great burden has weighed upon her heart ever since she was left behind by the battleships.
\nBut now, I see a rare smile on her face.

attributes.content: But we saved Chetleigh, Vina.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Yes, we did.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: My brain tells me that I should be relieved or happy.
\nBut I can't do it. I'm afraid to know how many stayed behind in that building, never to leave it.
\nEverything that happened there seems like a dream.
\nIs this what victory feels like? It's so weighty.

attributes.content: Would things have gotten so bad if everyone was fully committed to fighting for Victoria from the very beginning?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No, they all firmly believe that they are fighting for Victoria.
attributes.name: Siege
Siege
attributes.content: It's the other way round. Things have already spiraled out of control. Therefore...

attributes.name: Siege
attributes.content: We're fighting for ourselves now.
Siege, one of the survivors from Chetleigh has brought us a surprise.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: His family collected Gaulish artifacts, and his father once picked up a little Victorian object from Lingones's former route.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: It wasn't anything valuable, so it has been sitting in a warehouse for a long time. He gave it to us before we left as a gift of gratitude, and Horn recognized it immediately.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: This is an IFF beacon used in IFVs. It emits a signal that allows Victorian armies to identify the bearer's affiliation.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: It contains a military identification code?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Yes. This black box belonged to the Victorian Army. I'm familiar with the symbol on it.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: But I thought that the unit that it once belonged to no longer exists, lost in the ruins of Gaul—
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: —the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: A unit of legend, predecessor to Tempest Platoon. This thing took a long journey back to Victoria.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Back to us.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.text: 'The Exemplars'...
The present dukes may not recognize this ancient unit. At best, it might prevent direct artillery strikes.
\nBut the more important thing is...
The mission of the unit was inscribed inside the box.
The Exemplars
\n\n'We make miracles.'

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Consider it a gift from fate.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What's this...? The beacon that Lieutenant Shearer left us has picked up a signal.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Shearer?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Lady Delphine, there has been a change of circumstances at Irnclad Galavae...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: We are approaching your position now. ETA in one hour.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Be prepared for unhappy news... and a guest who insists on seeing you.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Your wounds! What a shoddy work of first aid!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: It may look like the wounds have closed, but the inflammation wasn't effectively treated, which explains the fever.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: With serious wounds like these, it's important that they're treated by a doctor and all vital signs monitored, reducing the chance of lingering after-effects.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You're fortunate that it was a piece of metal, not Originium crystal. When you're dealing with Sarkaz witchcraft devices, even the slightest touch could be infectious.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Even if it wasn't directly caused by Originium, there was a high risk of infection given the circumstances. It's incredible that your blood Originium levels still remain at normal levels.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You really should thank your lucky stars.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Well, it was a chaotic situation, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: At least I'm alive. It pays to have a strong constitution.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Fine. Lady Delphine has explained what happened.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: It was a battle worthy of study in the war colleges, given the difference in strength between the two sides. Most of the people on your side weren't even regulars...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Oh? Should I be sad that no one will remember what we did?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You're wrong on that, Siege.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'll remember. The soldiers outside will remember. The survivors of Chetleigh will remember.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Most legends are not born from official records.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I didn't know you were the type to say things like that.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Ahem.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Well, I've wrapped your wounds again. Don't try to blow me off with excuses like 'strong constitution', because I'm going to be keeping a close eye on your condition. I'm the doctor in this room.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'll be checking on your friends too, and the injured soldiers and civilians.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Thanks, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Also...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I suggest you check on that guest. I'm not sure if Lady Delphine is ready to handle her on her own.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I sincerely apologize for my behavior before, and my misplaced assessment about you.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: There is one thing on which I won't budge, however. You're too impulsive and emotional.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You shouldn't be trying to solve every problem on your own. Turn around once in a while, and you'll find plenty of people ready to help.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: *Glug* *glug*— whew!
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Take it easy, Aunt Manning.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Sarkaz were everywhere on my way here! I thought I was going to die.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Thank goodness that Lieutenant Shearer was tracking Irnclad Galavae, which was how he got there in time to save my life.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: He's a decent man, but lacks flexibility. Those men would never allow him to board the ship.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: You said you escaped Irnclad Galavae? What's happening there?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It makes me angry just thinking about it! Those damned officers charged into the central hub of the fortress and pointed their swords at me! Marquess Vontaire must be behind this!
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: I found an opportunity to change into inconspicuous clothes and escape. The fortress elevator almost ripped my dress!
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Sounds like you really were lucky.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I thought I was just coming along with your mother to see how things were going on the front lines, and to take you home. What's the worst that could happen, safe inside a nomadic fortress? Who would have thought...?
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: The old Dukes of Windermere would be proud of Mother.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: But you're the Duke of Windermere now, Delphine.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Auntie, you're hurting me... what's that look on your face?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The general staff were eager to go back because... they believed the Duke's death was caused by a Leithanian plot.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: You want to laugh, don't you? But they have evidence. Leithanien may not be in league with the Sarkaz, but they undoubtedly caused this situation.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: What? Leithanien?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The staff are cautious about accusing Leithanian nobles directly, but they have set their sights on the rebellions going on the provinces.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: No one wants to come all this way to fight the Sarkaz, only to return and find the demesne they have defended for centuries has fallen under Leithanian control.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: You're her daughter, Delphine. Your duty will come soon.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Now, let me rest... then we'll leave this place.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Leave? To where?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You should not be with these peasants.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Watch your words! Don't call them peasants!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Alright, Delphine, listen.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: If you really care about them, really think that they're heroes, a part of Victoria...
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: ...Think of how many people like them are there in your mother's demesne.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: If you really want to protect these people, take my advice and seek aid from the Duke of Caster to return to your demesne and take charge.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Perhaps you will have to become a Caster vassal... but you'll be able to fulfill your duty.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: What are you balking at? Did you fall in love with them just because they fought alongside you? You've stopped loving your own subjects?
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Accept it, Delphine... you and your mother have suffered enough.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Accept Duke Caster's proposal, and at least Windermere will be spared from devastation.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Why do you hesitate? Do you really want to be a vagabond forever, leaving your family, your bloodline and your duty behind?
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: ...I understand.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm Mother's daughter. You're right, I have a responsibility, not just to my friends, but to the subjects of Windermere as well.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Why did the Swordguards leave me behind, when I still had such a duty?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: If this was a duty glorious beyond all doubt, why do you come to me in such a condition?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You're right. If Windermere has fallen under the cloud of conspiracy, then I feel both the obligation and desire to do something about it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But I...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We're with you, Delphine. Say what you want to say.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Sorry. I couldn't hold back anymore.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Do you know what we just went through, madam?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: And you are...?
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: I'm not going with you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You have a duty!
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: I'm my mother's daughter, comrade to these warriors, and nothing else.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Even if I once was... I don't believe it anymore.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I stood here for them, so that their lives would no longer be the playthings of people like you, and I'm not going anywhere until I've bled my last.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Leave.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I hope the Sarkaz don't take you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: The Viscount's face is a spectacle of color, but Delphine gives her no further chance to speak.
\nShe leaves with her head bowed in the direction of Lieutenant Shearer.
Delphine's expression is calmer than I thought it would be. What she said... what she went through...
\nIt made me think of an old friend.
\nDelphine did not make the same mistake. Tragedy will not strike again.
\nBut what was the price?
The death of a loved one. A swift betrayal.
\nApparently, I was rather concerned how Delphine would react to these things.
Delphine smiles at me. It seems she has settled down.

attributes.content: I'm fine. Let's go.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: The same thing cannot happen again.

attributes.content: Head west once you leave the camp. If you're lucky enough, you should be able to reach the kind Duke of Caster.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Do you think you can survive without the Duke's protection?
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: We can, and we will.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Alright... I'm going to Duke Caster. I'll take a leisurely pace. This is your last chance.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: Come with me, and we'll all live.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: I won't stop you.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But the work of Delphine and her mother...
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: No, I'm not the one who's wrong... you're naive, stupid, foolishly believing that you're right.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.content: So be it.
attributes.name: Exhausted Viscount

attributes.text: I see her off on a vehicle not meant for rough terrain, leaving under the cover of darkness with a small escort.
I turn around to look at our group.
\nHundreds, thousands of eyes converge upon a single spot. Some are soldiers laughing with each other, others are civilians, celebrating.
\nThe camp falls silent.
\nThey are waiting for an answer.
Mine.

attributes.content: You heard her. It was undoubtedly an attractive proposal for many people.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We survived the worst of times together, Vina.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But what now? What happens when the morale and spirit that burns so brightly now is worn away by hardship and suffering?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Who will tell them where to go?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: I do not answer, not yet.
\n...He's here.
\nA creature with golden mane walks amongst the crowd. He looks at me.
\nI wanted to see the answer in his eyes, hear a word of advice in these fleeting moments.
But he gives no answers. All he does is look at me, waiting for me to find the answer.
\nYes. Perhaps he is not even there.

attributes.content: Lend me your ears.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If any among you still have faith in the proud dukes that are the faces of our Victoria, you should go with that woman now.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No one would fault your decision.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: The crowd rustles, but no one leaves.

attributes.content: None among you?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Is it not our instinct to seek protection from the powerful? It's nothing to be ashamed of.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I would very much like to. Oh how I wish that this sorry sword I carry had the power to protect my friends, such that none among them would die.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: She would very much like to. How many times has she cried when no one was watching? Wishing that someone could have saved her mother's life.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You would very much like to. Don't look away, I know you would. The Sarkaz wouldn't have butchered your brother so badly you couldn't even identify his corpse, if the troops that were supposed to escort you didn't flee.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But none among you have left.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You know that those nobles don't care about you in the slightest.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But do you really need to seek the strength and protection of another?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It's always been like that for us. We keep worshipping people and things that never really gave us anything, become their willing slaves.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Massacre, infection, besiegement. We survived all that, on our own strength!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We all want to go home. We all want this rotten war to end. But we can't win by hiding.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The fastest way is to give those warmongering bastards hiding in Londinium the old one-two in the face!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If the dukes won't do it, we will!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If no one will take us home, we'll walk home ourselves!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: A gift fell into our laps, a unit ID that the dukes left behind in Gaul.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It was called the Exemplars. They were elites, the will of the nation, with a long list of accolades.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But now, they are nothing more than this little box in my hands.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It has no special powers. But we can take it back to Londinium—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Punch those warmongering bastards in the face, throw this in the faces of the dukes, and tell them—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: This bloody land is OUR land!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: I want to go home, to the gym where my friends were.
\nThey want to go home, to the lives they once had.
We cannot rely on others anymore. We cannot expect justice to be served on its own.
\nI smash my hammer into the earth with all the strength I can muster.
\nI do not know why I did it. All I know is that I can no longer hold back my anger.
Bam!
The hammer silences all other sounds.
'The Exemplars!'
It's the Glasgow Gang that first breaks the silence.
'The Exemplars!'
Then, they are joined by Delphine.
'The Exemplars!'
Until everyone joins in.
'The Exemplars!' 'The Exemplars!' 'The Exemplars!'

attributes.content: Say, I had a strange dream—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I dreamed that a golden beast was taking a walk through our camp.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Good omen, perhaps?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Let's hope it all goes smoothly.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Wonder if the Self-Salvation Corps arrived at Brentwood before us...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: We'll have even more hands once we join up with them.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Who would have thought, a few days ago, that we would have our own army?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I kind of like the name the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Are you sure about this though, Vina? Are we bringing all of them back to Londinium?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Very few of them are ready to fight the Royal Court head-on.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Perhaps...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There will be more sacrifices along the way.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'll protect them.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Or maybe there will come a day when they don't need anyone's protection anymore.
attributes.name: Siege
